user.is_staff: Allow user to connect to Vulture's admin
user.is_superuser: Allow user to be root on Vulture's admin

intf.name: Interface name
intf.ip: IP adress when Apache's listening is needed
intf.remote_proxy: Proxy address located between Vulture and backend's applications
intf.sso_update_access_time: Reset timeout each time user does something in Vulture
intf.cas_auth: Authentication bound to interface and portal CAS (used only when application is undefined)
intf.cas_display_portal: Display portal (applications' list) after authentication (overwrite option above)

localization.country: Language to translate (if another language is needed, please send a mail to vulture's mailing list)
localization.message: Message to translate (used when error message is displayed)

importexport.path: Full path for import / export database file

ldap.name: Authentication name
ldap.user_attr: User attribute to look for when connecting
ldap.group_attr: Group attribute to look for when ACLing
ldap.are_members_dn: Search attribute is a full DN
ldap.chpass_attr: Vulture can check when changing password is needed and do an action if needed. You have to use an LDAP filter to check if changing password is needed
ldap.user_account_locked_attr: Like password, it's possible to check if account is locked

radius.name: Authentication name
radius.secret: Secret shared between RADIUS server and Vulture

acl.name: ACL name
acl.auth: Referential for fetching users and groups (SQL ou LDAP)

sso.name: Web SSO (Single Sign On) name
sso.follow_get_redirect: Before sending form data, Vulture GETs the form page. This checkbox avoids the redirection following during this step.
sso.is_post: Before sending form data, Vulture will first search for form page to detect random variables needed by authentication (ex: CSRF Protection). If checkbox is checked, Vulture doesn't GET the page et POST directly authentication info to Login URL.
sso.auth: Referential used for saving profiles data (SQL or LDAP)
sso.table_mapped: Table name which contains profiles data

security.name: Security rule name
security.rules: mod_security directives (see mod_security doc for more)

app.name: Internet name (as "app1.com")
app.intf: Interface(s) binded with this application. It's possible to select one or more. To unselect, hold Ctrl when cliquant in an empty space
app.url: Internet name of Vulture's protected app (as "http://*****" /!\ no trainling slash)
app.appearance: Appareance related to this app (overwrite interface appearance)
app.remote_proxy: URL of the proxy server between Vulture and backend app
app.auth: Authentication methods related to this app
app.auth_basic: Display a popup prompting for username and password instead of displaying form
app.display_portal: Display a list with all applications after a successfull authentication instead of redirecting to internal application
app.logon_url: Page where to send profile's data for authentication
app.security: Mod_security rules to protect this application
app.update_access_time: Reset timeout each time user does something in Vulture
app.canonicalise_url: Transfer raw URL to backend application. /!\ This may cause security flaw

appearance.name: Appearance name
appearance.acl_tpl: Template when ACL failed (instead of displaying 403 error)

template.name: Template name
template.value: HTML code corresponding to this template type. Every HTML markup are allowed plus dynamic elements above

css.name: CSS name
css.value: CSS code. Every markups are allowed

plugin.uri_pattern: Pattern to match in incoming URL
plugin.type: Plugin type to associate with pattern
plugin.app: Range for pattern. Leave empty to apply this plugin to every interface and every application
plugin.options: For rewrite mode, please fill this field with redirect URL

plugincontent.app: Range for pattern. Leave empty to apply this plugin to every interface and every application
plugincontent.type: Modification type : add header/content, replace header/content or delete header/content

pluginheader.app: Range for pattern. Leave empty to apply this plugin to every interface and every application
pluginheader.type: Modification type : add header, replace header or delete header

blackip.app: Range for pattern. Leave empty to apply this plugin to every application
blackip.ip: This may be a list (separated by space) of IP address, or network (CIDR notation)
